intro: Psychotria richardiana, commonly known as the "Richard's Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant is also notable for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
